page.title: 06Isolation of a Deaf Child
page.content: We wanted to find out what life was like for a totally deaf child living in an isolated farm in the area. He is 11 years old. His parents feel that local people are not very enlightened and tend to treat him as if he was simple. He gets frustrated. He has been going away to school since he was 3. He was very shocked at first and developed diabetes. He comes home every weekend. The County pay for his education - 8,000 pounds per annum - although he goes to an independent deaf school in another County. He enjoys more out of school activities than he could participate in at home. He goes to "Cubs" and has won his Gold Award, plays football and attends youth club. He is a pleasant outgoing child with a good sense of humour. He doesn't have any special friends.
